description: With the poor forecast north continuing, it was finally time to take to England again. Well, basically. Their efforts to name each individual mound top down't' there in't' Borders is admirable. I am quite sad we didn't get to bag White Cleuch and Black Rig. Anyway, started off pretty windy but ended up being a decent proj. Not too much rain, mostly sunshine. It was also a very unexpected five-thousand feet day. Will never forget the legend on Beinn Donald One having to backtrack a fence to get cairn: sticks. Admirable. Tried for a coffee in Moffat afterwards but too late. Made up for it in the evening though with the first desk wasted of the year; some Double Disco's and Erdies. Ha, and three-quarter-bottle-rum.
